main event: On April 6, 1956, a bright object was observed overhead as a red-orange light, which disappeared piece by piece over the horizon.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for about 15-30 seconds,The object was described as brighter than the city lights but not as bright as the sun,It appeared to be elliptical and emitted no sound,The sky was clear with good visibility during the observation,The object was at a significant height compared to familiar aircraft.
witness description: travelers on a highway towards Bakersfield
